commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Move classes into pookie packages
Level-4: Add todo, deadline, event task types
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented Task types (todo, deadline, event) as subclasses and parsing for /by and /from /to formats.
AddCommand now supports more task types.
Task has been refactored into an abstract class. Tasks now have to be of a certain type. Raw Tasks are no longer supported.

Added semi automated text UI testing for pookie and updated the runtest scripts
for windows and unix. Added sample input and EXPECTED output.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 5: Fix AddCommand parsing error messages
commitResults.messageBody:
Parse /by, /from, /to as tokens so missing/empty fields produce the correct
specific error messages instead of falling back to the generic one.
Add new Task#getDescription method to task to support updated parsing.

Throw PookieException when user inputs an invalid command.
Update test case to to reflect Pookie's new error messages.
Update format for printing task when a task is added.
Update MarkCommand and UnmarkCommand to throw PookieException

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix missing PookieException import in mark/unmark
Level-6: Add support for delete command
commitResults.messageBody:
Add DeleteCommand class.
Refactor TaskList to use ArrayList, replacing aray-based task storage for easier
add/remove operations.
Add TaskList#deleteTask to remove a task by index.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete command support in Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
Add handling of delete command in Parser
Update input and EXPECTED test cases for delete command

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-7: Add task saving using persistent file storage
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Storage class for peristent task saving
Add getter methods to DeadlineTask and EventTask

commitResults.messageTitle: Deprecate Task#getStatusIcon(), Task#getTypeIcon(); use getStatus(), getType() instead

commitResults.messageBody:
Call saveTaskList() after Delete, Mark and Unmark commands
Add persistent storage instance to Command parent class and setStorage method

Refactor DeadlineTask and EventTask to take in LocalDate as constructor
Refactor AddCommand to parse date string into LocalDate
Refactor Storage to parse store and load date strings

Add batch command support to commands

pause JavaFX shutdown after exit to keep the farewell visible
sleep in CLI loop before terminating on exit command

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user documentation with comprehensive user guide
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace template README with complete Pookie user guide
Create user-focused README.md
Add command summary table for quick reference
Include practical examples for all features

Add FAQ section covering common user questions

commitResults.messageTitle: Update README to change emoticon from 'OwO' to '^w^'
Add response when nothing is found with find command

commitResults.messageBody:
- Extract token parsing and validation into dedicated methods
  (extractDeadlineParts, extractEventParts) for cleaner task creation
- Replace magic array indices with named records (DeadlineParts, EventParts)
  for self-documenting code and type safety
- Consolidate date parsing and validation into parseInputDate() to eliminate
  duplicate error handling and reduce method count
- Simplify createDeadlineTask() and createEventTask() to focus on business logic
  while delegating concerns to helper methods
- Add validation to reject events where start date is after end date

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments in Task and Command
Refactor for better SLAP in Storage.java
Add JavaDoc comment for ParseInputDate in AddCommand.java
Fix extra newline in AddCommand, Command and Ui messages
Refactor: Extract parsing and formatting utilities to pookie.util
commitResults.messageBody:
Command.java has multiple responsibilities: parsing indices, formatting
tasks, and orchestrating batch operations.

Parsing and formatting logic are utility concerns that should be separated
from command decision-making.

Let's extract index parsing and task formatting into dedicated utility
classes, improving separation of concerns and enabling reuse.

- Create pookie.util.IndexParser with all index parsing logic
- Create pookie.util.TaskFormatter with all task formatting logic
- Update Command.java to delegate to these utilities

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Simplify MarkCommand and UnmarkCommand using batch operations
commitResults.messageBody:
MarkCommand and UnmarkCommand have duplicate logic: parse indices, fetch
tasks, apply an operation, save, and format response.

Reducing duplication makes the code easier to maintain and extend.

Let's extract the common batch operation pattern into a reusable
executeBatchOperation method. MarkCommand and UnmarkCommand now delegate
to this method with lambdas specifying their specific operation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: Address checkstyle violations and documentation gaps
commitResults.messageBody:
Several files have issues preventing clean builds: missing javadoc,
inconsistent formatting, and HTML entities in javadoc.

Clean builds help catch problems early and maintain code quality
standards.

Let's:
- Add javadoc to Storage constructor
- Escape HTML characters in AddCommand javadoc
- Fix indentation and formatting in GUI classes
- Use uppercase for static final fields (INDEX_PARSER, FORMATTER)

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: Exclude GUI classes from text-UI test compilation
commitResults.messageBody:
text-ui-test compilation fails because it tries to compile GUI classes
(Launcher, Main, MainWindow, DialogBox) that depend on JavaFX, which is
not available in the plain javac classpath.

Excluding these classes allows text-UI tests to compile and run without
needing the full Gradle build system.

Let's filter out JavaFX-dependent classes from the text-ui-test build.
